entry.title: [ios] Fork the save card infobar delegate for iOS
entry.content:
As we will be adding another layer of code specific to iOS to the save card delegate, it makes sense to make an extension of

AutofillSaveCardInfoBarDelegateMobile for iOS instead of using

#if BUILDFLAG(IS_IOS).



This also has the advantage of moving the ownership of the

implementations specific to iOS to the Chrome on iOS team.



This CL is part of the chain of CLs to make the autofill and password

infobars more sticky by changing the ShouldExpire() logic of the

infobar delegates.



DD: http://shortn/_NhqRi8yuaW

entry.title: Make sure the root surface has its surface ID updated when unevicted
entry.content:
The current code sets a flag to allocate a new surface ID for the ui

compositor root surface when one of its embeddees are shown. This flag

is set when an embeddee is evicted and the ui compositor is no longer

visible (and evicting the root surface is enabled). But, if a new

embeddee is created and shown, then its flag will not be set, so a new

surface ID will not be allocated for the ui compositor root surface.



This can happen if a tab is created for an evicted window, which can

happen in lacros if a link in a PWA is clicked while there is at least

one lacros window open and all lacros windows are evicted.



Bug: 330301468, 330930677

Test: CQ, local testing

Change-Id: Iad812294349ccd0df488a5dde687e1c42c0ebbac

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5400080

Reviewed-by: Jonathan Ross

entry.title: Allow FedCM sharing grants to resolve Storage Access requests
entry.content:
This implements an integration between FedCM and SAA (behind a flag)

which allows calls to document.requestStorageAccess to resolve

(without creating a new permission grant) if there is a corresponding

FedCM permission *and* the `kIdentityCredentialsGet` permission policy

is provided (whose default is 'self').



This CL adds the prototype and unit tests; browsertests and WPTs will

be added in followups.



Bug: 330574529

entry.title: Prevent calling CountFeature() until ContainerInfoForClient is sent
entry.content:
When AssociatedRemote is used, its method must not be called before the

AssociatedReceiver is sent to a counter part. Otherwise, the mojo call

will crash. We expected DCHECK find this out, but it actually seems not

and hit by a null pointer exception in crbug.com/40918057.



This change adds an additional flag that is only updated when the

associated receiver has been sent to the renderer so that CountFeature()

won't be called before the associated receiver has been sent.



Bug: 40918057

Change-Id: Ia889caed7e2fbaab36bdcc42142236605c59c302

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5400180

Reviewed-by: Shunya Shishido

Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

Reviewed-by: Minoru Chikamune

Auto-Submit: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

Reviewed-by: Hiroki Nakagawa

Commit-Queue: Rakina Zata Amni

entry.title: Don't map oklab/oklch lightness of 0/100% to black/white
entry.content:
When this change was implemented the spec language was clear that with

any l value of 0 or 100% the values of a and b should be zero and

the resulting color will be black or white. Now it simply says that this

will happen automatically due to "gamut mapping of the display":



https://drafts.csswg.org/css-color-4/#specifying-lab-lch



Gamut mapping itself is still an arena of great debate, but in the

meantime this discontinuity is jarring to web authors and is not

implemented in other UAs. This CL rolls it back.



There are a few tests that are testing the specific behavior before the

rollback. They could be deleted, but in the meantime I'm simply adding

them to the failures.



Bug: 329106317

Change-Id: I7c908d89b4d904c1567f1a535f7b0959728855ff

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5400609

Commit-Queue: Aaron Krajeski

Reviewed-by: Philip Jägenstedt

entry.title: Reland "[AvatarButton] Fix signin paused state not clearing on signout + cleanup"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 97e5f0c6015dfc996b4281fcd593e9f908c9366c



Reason for revert: There could be a case where a StateProvider

could call for an update during the construction of all the States.

This would cause a crash since no state are currently computed or

active.



Fix in reland: Splitting the creation of the state map and the

initialization of the States (where they could potentially call

an update). Also added a layer of initialization for the

StateManager to be only created once the view (AvatarButton) is

added to the main widget to ensure that all the resources are

available.



The code changes are the same as the original CL except for the logic

mentioned above which is added (Diff with Patchset 1 for the new

changes).



Original change's description:

> [AvatarButton] Fix signin paused state not clearing on signout + cleanup

>

> Signin paused state was not active anymore, and signing out of Chrome

> did not trigger a state change. Listening to primary account change

> fixes the issue.

>

> Refactoring parts:

> - Cleaned up the StateManager code to only compute new state

> internally or by request of StateProvider implementations, to make

> sure all the states control the active state and updates properly.

> - Injected specific logic of some StateProviders from the

> AvatarToolbarButtonDelegate into the StateProvider itself, and

> give a way to retrieve the StateProvider from the StateManager

> to read the value, when that State is the button active state.

> - Removed the icon related updates from the StateManager as they

> should not alter the state.

>

> Bug: b:329802297

> Change-Id: I0728747601de816cfe477a1ad2356c1e4b6bebb3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5380711

> Reviewed-by: David Roger

> Commit-Queue: Ryan Sultanem

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278381}



Bug: b:329802297

Change-Id: I929e3223c36e346260a6dd5e8e1a61bab57f0527

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5400780

Reviewed-by: David Roger

entry.title: Adds OS macros and buildflags for visionOS/watchOS.
entry.content:
Updates build_config.h to support the visionOS and watchOS

platforms. With this change, IS_IOS becomes both an individual

platform as well as a family of platforms (iOS, Mac Catalyst, watchOS,

visionOS). The child platform macros are named accordingly, for

example IS_IOS_VISION.



We considered creating a new IS_APPLEMOBILE family instead, but felt

that updating every existing use of IS_IOS would be too invasive at

this stage.



Bug: 331226142, 331320406

Change-Id: I975b48dfca70c2c02358e17c3298fa80fef27f67

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5396396

entry.title: Remove WebThemeEngine from ColorSchemeHelper
entry.content:
This change removes the web_theme_engine_ member and the forward

declaration of the class from the ColorSchemeHelper. Previously, we

relied on the WebThemeEngine to make changes to forced colors. However,

with the usage of the in_forced_colors web setting in Blink

(see CL:5368321), the WebThemeEngine is no longer necessary within the

ColorSchemeHelper class.

entry.title: [digital credential] Move IdentityRequestProvider to a separate dict
entry.content:
In this CL, we further decouple the Digital Credential API [1] from

the FedCM API [2] by moving the protocol/request parameters into its

own dictionary that is only accessible by the Digital Credential API

but not from FedCM, and vice versa, so that the appropriate

parameters are parsed (or discarded) in each of these two APIs.



[1] https://wicg.github.io/digital-identities/

[2] https://fedidcg.github.io/FedCM/



Bug: 1416939

Change-Id: I322bcac9fb38eb52e3466162753e000146d652fd

entry.title: Sync ModelLoadManager cleanup: Remove `loaded_types_` member
entry.content:
This member tracked which data types had reached (at least) the

"loaded" state.

This CL changes ModelLoadManager to query the canonical state from the

ModelTypeControllers instead.



This "should" result in equivalent behavior, but it's really hard to

be sure. It definitely removes the risk of `loaded_types_` being out

of sync with the actual status (which was previously haphazardly

enforced via various (D)CHECKs, some of which triggered from time to

time).

not show the console insights setting. If enabled, DevTools should

entry.title: [//gpu] Pass texture target in ExportedSharedImage
entry.content:
This CL changes ExportedSharedImage to store ClientSharedImage's

`texture_target_` field directly rather than

`client_side_native_buffer_used_`. This will allow for several followup

enhancements:



* Pass the MacOS-specific texture target in SharedImageCapabilities and

have ClientSharedImage use that in computing the texture target rather

than the global `macos_specific_texture_target`. This will be possible

because the only ClientSharedImage creation paths that will need to

compute the texture target will be precisely those that take in the

SIIHolder.

* Eliminate the global `macos_specific_texture_target` and all the goop

around it.



Bug: 41494843

entry.title: Focus SaveUpdate and MovePassword bubble automatically
entry.content:
This CL introduces a new bubble state that can be used to show bubbles

automatically with focus. Previously if the bubble was triggered

automatically it was always without focus. This change is needed since

now there are flows that involve showing multiple bubbles in a row and

users shouldn't need to manually enter each one with them.



This state is then used to fix focus in SaveUpdate bubble and

MovePassword bubble if they were triggered as a followup to a

different bubble.

entry.title: Add usecounter for relative URL resolution in sandboxed srcdoc documents.
entry.content:
This CL adds a Blink WebFeature kSandboxedSrcdocFrameResolvesRelativeURL

to track the prevalence of sandboxed srcdoc frames that resolve

relative urls. Since resolving relative urls relies on the base url that

the document has inherited from its parent, this will provide data on

whether it is feasible to restrict sending base urls to such frames.

entry.title: MFVideoCapture: forward capture begin timestamps from MF
entry.content:
They are in an MFTIME which is supposed to be as monotonic as base::TimeTicks

In practice the offset there is 0.



Two possible MFSample attributes may contain it, so both are parsed.



A MediaFoundationVideoCaptureForwardSampleTimestamps feature is added

as a killswitch.



2 new histograms are added to monitor the timestamps temporarily.

entry.title: [DevTools] Add feature param for whether console insights is visible
entry.content:
by default



The value of this param is being passed on to DevTools. Depending on

its value, DevTools either visibly enables console insights by

default, or console insights needs to be enabled via settings first

before being visible.



We need this for capacity planning. We do not want to overload the

AIDA API servers. Therefore we will "silently" enable the feature

first (users need to enable it via settings), before gradually

rolling the feature out as visible by default.

entry.title: Add PlusAddressModelTypeController
entry.content:
Currently, PLUS_ADDRESS is running unconditionally if SyncPlusAddress

is enabled. This CL adds a model type controller and preconditions the

model type on PlusAddressesEnabled being enabled.



This is useful for two reasons:

- The first feature flag will be removed after some manual testing, once

server integration has finished. But the latter flag will be kept

around for the actual PlusAddress rollout. To avoid unnecessary

traffic on the server-side, only eligible users should query it.

- It gives us a place to put the logic for [1] in a future CL.

entry.title: Remove HttpStreamFactoryJobController's DanglingUntriaged annotations.
entry.content:
Also fix the reasons the annotations were necessary:



HttpStreamFactory was deleting its JobFactory before its

JobControllers, which have a raw pointer to it.



Also, JobControllers can now outlive their

HttpStreamRequest::Delegates, so need to null out that pointer

when it notifies them of its destruction. They were already nulling

out their `request_` at that point, and checking it before trying to

access their delegate, so this didn't lead to issues, apart from

requiring the DanglingUntriaged annotation.



Bug: 40212619

entry.title: Revert "[FspCache] Delete cache directory upon uninitialization"
entry.content:
This reverts commit bdaae62f5154bc48e3a91ec5c2b8f3c22678a290.



Reason for revert: This causes issues on Ubsan and ASAN builders, e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-ubsan-vptr/29181/overview



Original change's description:

> [FspCache] Delete cache directory upon uninitialization

>

> Each time a provider is initialized through

> CacheManager::InitializeForProvider() a new

> FspContentCache/ directory is made. When the

> provider is destructed, this folder will hang around on the user's

> disk. There is no clean up logic currently implemented. All of this is

> behind the FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystem and

> FileSystemProviderContentCache feature flags.

>

> Introduce CacheManager::UninitializeForProvider() to properly

> uninitialize the provider from the CacheManager. This will delete the

> FspContentCache/ and also remove it from the

> set of initialized providers.

>

> No part of the code calls CacheManager::UninitializeForProvider() but

> this will be implemented in a later CL.

>

> Also introduce GetProviderMountPath() to tidy up path construction.

>

> Bug: b/330812469

> Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderCacheManagerTest*

> Change-Id: Ie1b5459acd750a819dc6934b75dec69688e426cd

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5399829

> Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

> Reviewed-by: Ben Reich

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1279458}



Bug: b/330812469

Change-Id: Ia19f94870473e3b9c65a5dcfa3eeb7b6de390e8c

No-Presubmit: true

No-Tree-Checks: true

No-Try: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5402875

entry.title: [CSC] Support sticky permissions
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the permission for Captured Surface Control was scoped

to the capture-session - unlike all other permissions. This was done

until bespoke UX could be added to better reflect to the user that the

permission was granted and is active.



This CL makes the CSC permission into a normal, sticky permission, but

does so behind a default-disabled flag,

CapturedSurfaceControlStickyPermissions.



Later CLs will add the bespoke UX and then flip

CapturedSurfaceControlStickyPermissions to default-enabled.



(This ordering of the CLs is needed because the bespoke UX refers back

to the permission itself, which needs to appear in PageInfo. It also

supports better parallelization of the work.)



Bug: 1466247, 324468211

Change-Id: Icc1802d8d470365be010dfae0506dda641162b5e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5401741

entry.title: [ios] New template for .xcassets bundle compilation
entry.content:
Add a new template to compile .xcassets bundle as part of the assets

catalog compilation.



This template simplify assets declaration since there it is possible

to define a single target for all assets instead of one target per

asset.



Additionally, it fixes an issue where the build/config/ios/hardlink.py

script would be copying all files from the asset directory (i.e. if a

file was present on disk but not listed, it would be used). This could

result in flakiness since those unlisted file would not be known to

ninja, and not considered when checking whether the output is dirty.



An side benefit of this template is that by listing an .xcassets bundle

in the source, the generated Xcode project will show the asset catalog

in a nice way, allowing to look at the assets from within Xcode.



Convert the sample app //ios/intents/app:intents to use the template as

an example of usage for this template.



Bug: none

entry.title: [//gpu] Cache computed texture target in ClientSharedImage
entry.content:
This CL changes ClientSharedImage to cache `texture_target_` in an ivar.

This will pave the following path:

* Add a ClientSI constructor that takes in the texture target and pass

the texture target via ExportedSharedImage

* Eventually have the Windows use case for hardcoding EXTERNAL as the

texture target also use that constructor, thus solving that use case

* Pass the MacOS-specific texture target in SharedImageCapabilities and

have ClientSharedImage use that in computing the texture target rather

than the global `macos_specific_texture_target`. This will be possible

because the only ClientSharedImage creation paths that will need to

compute the texture target will be precisely those that take in the

SIIHolder.

* Eliminate the global `macos_specific_texture_target` and all the goop

around it.



Bug: 41494843

Change-Id: I93eabcff0dbd060dd4ee7271921e9f2a63541a1a

entry.title: Revert "[FspCache] Enable basic read/write support for ContentCache"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8077805051e94602309101aaf8f519c7d3139ec1.



Reason for revert: This change causes failures on MSan bots, e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/42160/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> [FspCache] Enable basic read/write support for ContentCache

>

> The `ContentCache` is acting like a hub to facilitate reading, writing

> and guarding access to files that are stored on the disk. This adds

> very basic support for read/write via the FSP API.

>

> Writers are supported iff they are writing contiguous chunks that

> haven't been written before. This precludes random access writers and

> concurrent writers to the same file. Readers are allowed random access

> iff the bytes requested are within the range that is available on disk.

>

> If any ContentCache streaming operation fails to write the requested

> bytes to disk yet the underlying FSP operation succeeded it will

> always appear as a success to the caller. Currently, however, if a

> local reader fails this will return a failure to the caller.

>

> Bug: b/331280525, b/331280403

> Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderContentCacheTest*

> Change-Id: Ib5e26a1dfe63fa281652306fd4f579fba034fd44

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5392244

> Commit-Queue: Ben Reich

> Reviewed-by: Cassy Chun-Crogan

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1279442}

entry.content:
This CL collects metrics when CCA scans a barcode and the Wi-fi protocol

is unsupported. The metrics will be collected from GA and CrOS events

BUG=b:309573972

entry.title: Revert "Media App: Use IDs to search for buttons in tests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 470ec51c14f1f8380e42264012c936dc866a5d02.



Reason for revert: This patch is suspected to cause failures on linux-chromeos-chrome builders, e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-chrome/40428/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Media App: Use IDs to search for buttons in tests

>

> The migration to CrOS components means we cannot rely on `ea-*`

> selectors anymore. Switch to a more generic selector to work under both

> contexts.

>

> Additionally update the media app CIPD version to point to a build that

> uses CrOS components.

>

> Release_Notes: http://go/media_app-x20/relnotes/Main/media_app_202403270700_RC00.html

>

> https://chrome-infra-packages.appspot.com/p/chromeos_internal/apps/media_app/app/+/k1WDApOAJXlhxbF8hqJfBbF8Vx4bbm32LYM-9lDTgfYC

entry.title: [iOS][Omnibox][ExperimentalTextField] Fix append arrow
entry.content:
When experimental text field is enabled on iOS 17, tapping the append

arrow selects all the text. This is due to

UITextSelectionDisplayInteraction triggering after the text is appended

in the omnibox. For some reason, the selectedRange is reset to select

everything.



This CL forces the selection to the end of the text field to avoid the

full selection.



Bug: 331622199

Change-Id: Ib627c4b3f6ac0d5e107c054eca4a9510ea4450be

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5401760

Reviewed-by: Gauthier Ambard

entry.title: Eliminate redundant zero-fill in MemEntryImpl::InternalWriteData
entry.content:
disk_cache::MemEntryImpl::InternalWriteData() was zero-filling memory

unnecessarily when it needed to expand the backing vector. Use the fact

that vector::resize() zero-fills and the fact that vector::insert() can

call memcpy() to avoid zero-fills when the backing vector is grown.



Change-Id: I559304324a08d855c9c32351ba84155d202d608d

entry.title: Sync secure DNS template URI for automatic mode
entry.content:
CL:5317742 introduced network identifiers in the secure DNS template

URI. As a result, the template URIs are reevaluated every time the

default network changes. To prevent spamming shill with repeating

D-Bus calls, CL:5317742 introduced a check to enforce that shill is

only sent the template URIs if the values change after the

template reevaluation.



This check introduced an error. The template URIs have initial

user-set values which are overridden by policy. If the policy is not

set, the template URIs have the same initial user-set values before and

after the template reevaluation. The check introduced in CL:5317742

prevents the initial user-set template URIs to be sent to shill.



This CL ensures that the initial user-set values of the template URIs

are forwarded to shill.



Bug: b/331126256

Test: tast run $DUT network.DNSProxy.chrome_doh_automatic

entry.title: [FspCache] Delete cache directory upon uninitialization
entry.content:
Each time a provider is initialized through

CacheManager::InitializeForProvider() a new

FspContentCache/ directory is made. When the

provider is destructed, this folder will hang around on the user's

disk. There is no clean up logic currently implemented. All of this is

behind the FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystem and

FileSystemProviderContentCache feature flags.



Introduce CacheManager::UninitializeForProvider() to properly

uninitialize the provider from the CacheManager. This will delete the

FspContentCache/ and also remove it from the

set of initialized providers.



No part of the code calls CacheManager::UninitializeForProvider() but

this will be implemented in a later CL.



Also introduce GetProviderMountPath() to tidy up path construction.



Bug: b/330812469

entry.title: [FspCache] Test a CacheManager is created with the right flags
entry.content:
Add CloudFileSystemBrowserTestWithContentCache to check that mounting

a CloudFileSystem with kFileSystemProviderCloudFileSystem and

kFileSystemProviderContentCache enabled creates a cache manager.



Add CloudFileSystemBrowserTestWithoutContentCache to check that mounting

a CloudFileSystem without kFileSystemProviderContentCache enabled

doesn't create a cache manager.



In order to mount a CloudFileSystem, a new testing provider class

FakeExtensionProviderForCloudFileSystem has to be registered via

Service::RegisterProvider() (done in

file_manager::test::MountProvidedFileSystem()). The

FakeExtensionProviderForCloudFileSystem::CreateProvidedFileSystem() will

be called by Service::MountFileSystem() where the CloudFileSystem

construction takes place.



FakeExtensionProviderForCloudFileSystem is customised to call a

on_cache_manager callback to allow the tests to check if a CacheManager

was created.



The motivation for this change is to be able to add tests for when the

Service unmounts the CloudFileSystem.



Bug: b/330812469

Test: --gtest_filter="*CloudFileSystemBrowserTest*"
